definition: to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: She was underdressed for the hiking trip and suffered hypothermia.
sentences.chinese: 她徒步旅行时穿得有些薄弱，因此以为浑身发冷。

sentences.english: The most common symptoms were chills and facial flushing .
sentences.chinese: 最常见的症状是发冷，颜面潮红。

sentences.english: He sniffled from a cold in the head.
sentences.chinese: 他因头部发冷而不停地喘粗气。

sentences.english: Hot heads and cold hearts never solve anything .
sentences.chinese: 头脑发热和心肠发冷不能解决问题。

sentences.english: And then an idea flashed in my mind; it sent a shudder5 all over of me.
sentences.chinese: 随即一个念头闪入我脑中，让我全身一阵发冷。

sentences.english: I felt a chill creep over me.
As I read, I felt cold chills running up and down my arms.
sentences.chinese: 读着这本意见簿，我身上感到一阵阵地发冷。

sentences.english: He was underdressed for the hiking trip and suffered hypothermia.
sentences.chinese: 他徒步旅行时穿得有些单薄，因此感觉浑身发冷。

definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
to weaken/to go soft (at the knees)
